name: system covers
description:
It looks like a mix between the Rubik's Cube and Tetris, but with a twist. Instead of squares, the game uses 'balls'. The goal is a slow countdown to the ball falling off. You'll have to move your cube around ambiguous obstacles, including potatoes, chips and it's not always clear which one will be there when you get there.
Players can select to play either as a team or individually, and have their own unique abilities. The team selection is a bit of a bug in the way the game's controls are laid out. The game's not set in stone just yet, though. Outhouse Media has promised that it has some 'starting blocks' that are 'easier to work with'. That means you'll be able to play the game for a while before getting stuck. It's currently only available in the UK, but there are plans to expand to other markets in the future. If you're interested in taking part, then head over to their website to sign up now. Tetris: The Second Encounter on the Oculus Rift (Full Review) Published: 16:17 EDT, 7 September 2017 | Updated: 18:31 EDT, 22 September 2017
